title: 113_hr1567
content: The Act titled "New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013" or "New Fair Deal CEO's Act of 2013" includes the elimination of sugar price support, production adjustment programs, and related sugar corporate welfare programs. It also involves terminating sugar tariffs and over-quota tariff rates. Additionally, it includes the termination of NOAA Fishery promotion and development subsidies, NOAA fisheries finance program, and Federal Railroad Administration programs. The Act titled "New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013" includes the elimination of sugar price support, production adjustment programs, and related sugar corporate welfare programs. It also involves terminating sugar tariffs and over-quota tariff rates. Additionally, it includes the termination of various programs such as high-speed rail, railroad rehabilitation, maritime administration, Appalachian Regional Commission, Economic Development Administration, and general provisions. The Act "New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013" eliminates sugar price support, production adjustment programs, and related sugar corporate welfare programs. It repeals the Sugar Price Support Authority, terminates marketing quotas and allotments for sugar, and excludes sugar from general USDA price support powers. The Act "New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013" eliminates sugar price support, production adjustment programs, and related sugar corporate welfare programs. It repeals the Sugar Price Support Authority, terminates marketing quotas and allotments for sugar, and excludes sugar from general USDA price support powers. Additionally, amendments are made to various sections regarding sugar beets, sugarcane, and other agricultural commodities. The "New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013" eliminates sugar price support and related programs. It repeals the Sugar Price Support Authority, terminates marketing quotas for sugar, and excludes sugar from USDA price support. Additionally, it restricts loans and price support for sugarcane and sugar beets processors. The Act eliminates sugar price support programs for sugar beets and sugarcane crops, using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation. It does not affect liability under previous laws. The Act eliminates sugar price support programs for sugar beets and sugarcane crops, using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation. Section 102 of the Act eliminates tariffs on raw cane sugar in the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. The Act eliminates sugar price support programs for sugar beets and sugarcane crops, using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation. Chapter 17 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on beet sugar. The Act eliminates sugar price support programs for sugar beets and sugarcane crops, using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation. Chapter 17 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on certain refined sugar. Chapter 17 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on certain refined sugar by replacing subheadings with a new subheading 1701.99.00 for "Other" with a duty rate of 42.05 cents/kg. Chapter 17 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on certain refined sugar by restructuring subheadings and inserting a new subheading with a corresponding article description. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on refined sugar with specific criteria for non-sugar solids content. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to eliminate tariffs on refined sugar derived from cane or beet, containing added coloring but not added flavoring matter, with a tariff rate of 42.50 cents/kg. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to remove additional U.S. notes and adjust the administration of tariff-rate quotas. These changes apply to goods entered after the enactment date. Additionally, NOAA fishery promotion and development subsidies under the Fish and Seafood Promotion Act of 1986 are terminated. Title II of the Fish and Seafood Promotion Act of 1986 is repealed, terminating the NOAA Fisheries Finance Program. This includes the termination of fishery loan programs involving fishing vessels, fishery facilities, aquaculture facilities, individual fishing quotas, and fishing capacity reduction programs. Additionally, Federal Railroad Administration programs such as high-speed rail, railroad rehabilitation and improvement, and railroad research and development are repealed. SEC. 303 repeals certain sections of title 49, United States Code related to railroad research and development. SEC. 401 terminates the Title IX guaranteed loan program under the Maritime Administration programs. The New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013 repeals Chapter 537 of title 46, United States Code, along with making clerical and conforming amendments to various sections within the same title. The New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013 makes amendments to various sections in title 46, United States Code, before its enactment date. The New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013 repeals sections related to ocean freight differential subsidies, terminates the Appalachian Regional Commission, Economic Development Administration, and concludes business. The President is required to conclude the affairs of terminated programs and activities as per the New Fair Deal Consolidating and Eliminating Outdated Subsidies Act of 2013. Any funds received from these terminated programs must still adhere to applicable laws and regulations.
